neighbors.name: Parkside At Buckeye HOA

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the HOA board or management company formally; acknowledge their role in maintaining community standards and offer a presentation on project aesthetics and property value protections.

neighbors.name: Parkside At Buckeye Homeowners Association
neighbors.claims: Parkside at Buckeye Homeowners Association is an Arizona nonprofit corporation established to govern the Parkside at Buckeye residential subdivision. The HOA is led by an elected board of homeowners, with Anjali Hans currently serving as President, alongside Vice-President Julio Soto and Treasurer Paul Valuch [HOA Parkside Board](https://hoaparkside.com/board/). The association utilizes Associated Asset Management (AAM) as its professional property management company, replacing previous management by Morrison Group [AAM Parkside Portal](https://www.associatedasset.com/update-contact-info/). The association’s activities center on enforcing community rules and maintaining property values, and it has not taken any publicly reported stance on outside development projects.
neighbors.influence_justification: Represents a single residential subdivision; primary influence is limited to internal community governance and local aesthetics.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the HOA board via President Anjali Hans and the management company (AAM); address residents’ concerns about noise, aesthetics, and property values.

citations.claim: Current Board President is Anjali Hans
citations.title: Parkside HOA Board Members

citations.claim: Managed by Associated Asset Management (AAM)
citations.title: AAM Community List

neighbors.name: Arizona Public Service Company
neighbors.claims: Arizona Public Service Company (APS) is the largest electric utility in Arizona, serving approximately 1.4 million customers statewide [APS About](https://www.aps.com/en/About/Our-Company/About-us). APS is the principal subsidiary of Pinnacle West Capital Corp. and actively develops energy infrastructure in Maricopa County. The utility owns and operates the 10 MW Desert Star Solar Plant on 118 acres in Buckeye, a project developed on the City of Phoenix landfill [Dibble Engineering](https://www.dibblecorp.com/projects/arizona-public-service-city-of-phoenix-desert-star-solar-plant/). In late 2024, APS secured agreements to add nearly 7,300 MW of renewable power, battery storage, and natural gas to its portfolio [APS Newsroom](https://www.aps.com/en/About/Our-Company/Newsroom/Articles/APS_Secures_its_Largest-Ever_Energy_Supply_to_Reliably_Serve_Customers). Additionally, APS has proposed the 'Desert Sun' natural gas plant near Gila Bend to support data center load growth [Fox 10 Phoenix](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OMbNjWEny-4). The company is heavily engaged in political advocacy regarding energy policy, having historically spent millions on regulator elections to protect business interests [Energy and Policy Institute](https://energyandpolicy.org/aps-ramps-up-spending-to-10-million-to-prevent-clean-energy-ballot/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Dominant regional utility provider with massive infrastructure footprint, active development projects (Desert Star, Desert Sun), and significant political spending power.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with APS’s resource acquisition team; emphasize project alignment with their 2024/2025 All Source RFP goals for renewable integration.

citations.claim: Operates 10 MW Desert Star Solar Plant in Buckeye
citations.title: Desert Star Solar Plant Project Profile

citations.claim: Secured agreements for 7,300 MW of new energy supplies
citations.title: APS Secures Largest-Ever Energy Supply

citations.claim: Proposed Desert Sun natural gas plant for data centers
citations.title: APS announces plans for new natural gas facility

citations.claim: Political spending on regulator elections
citations.title: APS Ramps Up Spending To $10 Million

neighbors.name: Mile High Borrower 1 Value LLC
neighbors.claims: Mile High Borrower 1 (Value) LLC is a Delaware-formed limited liability company registered to do business in Arizona and Florida [Florida Division of Corporations](https://search.sunbiz.org/Inquiry/CorporationSearch/SearchResults?InquiryType=EntityName&SearchNameOrder=MILEHIGHBORROWER1INCOME%20M210000042190&Detail=FL.DOS.Corporations.Shared.Contracts.FilingRecord). The entity shares a principal address with Progress Residential in Scottsdale, AZ, and is identified in disclosure documents as an affiliate of Progress Residential, one of the nation's largest single-family rental (SFR) operators [Progress Residential Disclosure](https://photos.harstatic.com/413153436/supplement/pdf-4.pdf?ts=2025-04-18T17:15:49.177). Public records indicate this entity serves as a special purpose vehicle for holding securitized single-family rental assets [FHCCI Report](https://www.fhcci.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/08/Who-Owns-Indy-Homes-8-9-23-3.pdf). The entity has been active in filing landlord-tenant actions in Maricopa County courts, consistent with high-volume rental operations [Maricopa Justice Courts](https://justicecourts.maricopa.gov/app/courtrecords/CaseInfo?casenumber=CC2022164221000).
neighbors.influence_justification: Out-of-state corporate investment vehicle; influence is financial rather than community-based. No record of participation in local zoning or development hearings.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via the parent company (Progress Residential) asset management team in Scottsdale; assure them that construction will not disrupt tenant retention.

citations.claim: Registered as foreign LLC in Florida and Arizona
citations.title: Florida Division of Corporations Filing

citations.claim: Affiliated with Progress Residential
citations.title: Affiliated Business Arrangement Disclosure Statement

citations.claim: Vehicle for securitized single-family rental assets
citations.title: Who Owns Indy Homes Report

citations.claim: Active in filing landlord-tenant actions
citations.title: Maricopa County Justice Courts Case History

neighbors.name: 2018-3 IH Borrower LP
neighbors.claims: 2018-3 IH Borrower LP is a Delaware limited partnership formed in 2018 as an indirect special-purpose subsidiary of Invitation Homes Inc. (NYSE: INVH), the largest owner of single-family rental homes in the United States [SEC 8-K](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1687229/000168722918000050/a8-k070218ih2018x3.htm). The partnership's registered agent is in Wilmington, Delaware, and its general partner (2018-3 IH Borrower GP LLC) operates from Invitation Homes' headquarters in Dallas, Texas [Bloomberg LEI](https://lei.bloomberg.com/leis/view/549300P8LU85T0HG5D74). The entity was established in connection with a $1.3 billion securitization transaction involving a collateral pool of 6,662 homes [SEC Ex-99.1](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1687229/000168722918000050/a8-k070218ih2018x3.htm). Nationally, Invitation Homes owns approximately 85,000 rental homes as of 2024 [SEC 10-K](https://s28.q4cdn.com/264003623/files/doc_financials/2024/ar/INVH-AR_BMK.pdf). In the Phoenix metro area, the company owns approximately 9,200 rental properties, making it a significant regional landlord [Opportunity Arizona](https://www.opportunityarizona.org/affordability-agenda). Invitation Homes has an explicit corporate stance supporting renewable energy, describing solar as a "clean, renewable and sustainable choice" and implementing a "Solar Easy" program for residents [Invitation Homes Solar](https://www.invitationhomes.com/solar-energy). The company's 2024 Impact Report highlighted the delivery of 60 new homes with rooftop solar and cited a pilot program in Phoenix focused on smart home technology and energy efficiency [Business Wire](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20250930245157/en/Invitation-Homes-Announces-Release-of-2024-Impact-Report). In September 2024, the parent company agreed to pay $48 million to settle Federal Trade Commission (FTC) allegations regarding undisclosed mandatory fees and unfair eviction practices [FTC](https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/news/press-releases/2024/09/ftc-takes-action-against-invitation-homes-deceiving-renters-charging-junk-fees-withholding-security). Public records indicate 2018-3 IH Borrower LP has filed numerous eviction actions in Maricopa County Justice Courts between 2020 and 2024 [Maricopa Justice Court](https://justicecourts.maricopa.gov/app/courtrecords/CaseInfo?casenumber=CC2024096466000).
neighbors.influence_justification: High - Controls ~9,200 local properties (significant landholder); subject of recent major federal regulatory action ($48M FTC settlement); active in local courts.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through Invitation Homes’ Dallas headquarters (asset management or ESG teams) regarding potential solar easements or community solar participation, as the company is actively piloting solar in Phoenix and monetizing renewable assets. Be aware of tenant-relation sensitivities given recent FTC settlement.

neighbors.profile_summary: Subsidiary of major REIT Invitation Homes. Owns ~9,200 homes in Phoenix. Supports renewables/solar as a revenue stream. Recently settled with FTC for $48M regarding fees/evictions.

citations.claim: 2018-3 IH Borrower LP is a Delaware limited partnership formed in 2018 as an indirect special-purpose subsidiary of Invitation Homes Inc.
citations.title: Invitation Homes Inc. Form 8-K June 28, 2018

citations.claim: The partnership’s registered agent is in Wilmington, Delaware, and its general partner (2018-3 IH Borrower GP LLC) operates from Invitation Homes’ headquarters in Dallas, Texas
citations.title: Bloomberg LEI Profile: 2018-3 IH Borrower LP

citations.claim: The entity was established in connection with a $1.3 billion securitization transaction involving a collateral pool of 6,662 homes
citations.title: Invitation Homes Inc. Form 8-K June 28, 2018

citations.claim: Nationally, Invitation Homes owns approximately 85,000 rental homes as of 2024
citations.title: Invitation Homes 2024 Annual Report

citations.claim: In the Phoenix metro area, the company owns approximately 9,200 rental properties
citations.title: Opportunity Arizona: The Affordability Agenda

citations.claim: Invitation Homes has an explicit corporate stance supporting renewable energy, describing solar as a "clean, renewable and sustainable choice"
citations.title: Invitation Homes: Solar Energy Information

citations.claim: The company's 2024 Impact Report highlighted the delivery of 60 new homes with rooftop solar and cited a pilot program in Phoenix
citations.title: Invitation Homes Announces Release of 2024 Impact Report

citations.claim: In September 2024, the parent company agreed to pay $48 million to settle Federal Trade Commission (FTC) allegations regarding undisclosed mandatory fees and unfair eviction practices
citations.title: FTC Takes Action Against Invitation Homes

citations.claim: Public records indicate 2018-3 IH Borrower LP has filed numerous eviction actions in Maricopa County Justice Courts between 2020 and 2024
citations.title: Maricopa County Justice Courts Case: CC2024096466000

neighbors.name: Novotny Revocable Trust
neighbors.claims: The Novotny Revocable Trust holds title to the property at 25263 W Parkside Ln S in Buckeye, AZ ([LoopNet](https://www.loopnet.com/property/25263-w-parkside-ln-s-buckeye-az-85326/04013-40035009/)). While the trust functions as a private estate planning vehicle, public records indicate an Erin Novotny serves as a Management Assistant for the Buckeye Planning and Zoning Commission ([Maricopa County Minutes](https://www.maricopa.gov/AgendaCenter/ViewFile/Minutes/_07222021-2460)). A definitive legal link between the staff member and this specific trust property could not be confirmed in the available dataset, but the shared surname in the local municipality is noted for context.
neighbors.influence_justification: While the trust itself appears private, the potential familial link to Erin Novotny, a Management Assistant for the Buckeye Planning and Zoning Commission, suggests a possible medium level of connection to local municipal processes.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the trustees with deference to potential municipal connections; verify if the Planning Commission staff member is a beneficiary or trustee to ensure appropriate conflict-of-interest protocols are followed.

neighbors.profile_summary: Private family trust potentially linked to local municipal planning staff.

citations.claim: Property located at 25263 W Parkside Ln S in Buckeye, AZ
citations.title: LoopNet Property Record 400-35-009

citations.claim: Erin Novotny listed as Management Assistant for Buckeye Planning and Zoning
citations.title: Maricopa County Planning and Zoning Commission Minutes

neighbors.name: LJA SDIRA LLC
neighbors.claims: LJA SDIRA LLC is an Arizona limited liability company holding parcel 400-35-008 at 25255 W Parkside Ln S ([Redfin](https://www.redfin.com/AZ/Buckeye/25255-W-Parkside-Ln-S-85326/home/27723875)). The entity name suggests a Self-Directed IRA structure. Real estate records link the property to Brad Wood and High Profile Luxury Properties, LLC, suggesting the property is managed or owned by real estate professionals ([Redfin](https://www.redfin.com/AZ/Buckeye/25255-W-Parkside-Ln-S-85326/home/27723875)). Brad Wood is an active real estate agent and investor in the region ([Redfin Agent](https://www.redfin.com/AZ/Buckeye/26163-W-Tonto-Ln-85396/home/27843615)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Real estate investor/agent with transactional interest but no evidence of broad political community leadership.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via Brad Wood or High Profile Luxury Properties LLC; focus on financial value propositions and compatibility with their investment portfolio.

neighbors.profile_summary: Investment vehicle linked to local real estate professional Brad Wood.

citations.claim: Property linked to Brad Wood and High Profile Luxury Properties, LLC
citations.title: Redfin Property History 25255 W Parkside Ln S

citations.claim: Brad Wood identified as real estate agent in Buckeye
citations.title: Redfin Listing Agent Info

neighbors.name: Mastronardi Family Trust
neighbors.claims: The Mastronardi Family Trust owns the property at 25377 W Yanez Ave in Buckeye ([LoopNet](https://www.loopnet.com/property/25377-w-yanez-ave-buckeye-az-85326/04013-40035432/)). The family is deeply integrated into large-scale agriculture, specifically serving as owners and directors of Golden Jem Produce and Red Sun Farms, major greenhouse operators ([Auglaize County Court](https://www2.auglaizecounty.org/sites/default/files/documents/CLAIM%2047%20SUPPLEMENTAL%20SUBMISSION%20OF%20617885%20ONTARIO%20LIMITED.pdf)). The trust has also been listed on permits for other residential construction projects in Buckeye, indicating active development interests ([Maricopa County Permits](https://www.maricopa.gov/Archive.aspx?ADID=4793)). Jamie Mastronardi is a known industry voice in agricultural produce marketing ([Produce Business](https://cdn.producebusiness.com/2016/09/pb-feb-2009.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Significant agricultural business owners with active construction permits in the county; likely have sophisticated understanding of land use.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as sophisticated commercial operators; discuss potential for agrivoltaics or how the project aligns with their broader agricultural and development interests.

neighbors.profile_summary: Trust associated with major international greenhouse produce operators (Red Sun Farms/Golden Jem).

neighbors.name: Farms Holdings LP / Genus LP / Resource Holdings Trust
neighbors.claims: Genus, L.P. is a California limited partnership formed on October 15, 2002, with a principal address in San Diego and Devcal Corporation (Temecula, CA) listed as its General Partner ([BizProfile](https://www.bizprofile.net/ca/san-diego/genus-l-p)). While the entity holds agricultural parcels in Buckeye, it has demonstrated active engagement in renewable energy markets; Genus LP sold 2,004 acres in Eloy to EDF Renewables Development Inc. for $22.6 million in December (Year TBD based on context, likely recent), indicating a willingness to transact with energy developers ([Rose Law Group](https://www.roselawgroup.com/huge-acreage-assembled-for-renewable-projects-in-pinal-county-court-rich-director-of-rose-law-groups-energy-utility-infrastructure-department-comments-in-pbj-on-the-state-of-energy-in-ar/)). This transaction suggests the entity is not merely a passive holder but actively rotates capital into and out of development-ready land ([Rose Law Group](https://www.roselawgroup.com/areas-of-practice/renewable-energy/)). Beneficial ownership remains obscured through the corporate structure, but the sale to a major renewable developer provides a strong signal of their commercial alignment.
neighbors.influence_justification: Low – Out-of-state investment entity. While they control significant acreage, their influence is transactional rather than community-based.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage as a commercial partner. The entity has a documented history of selling large tracts to renewable energy developers (EDF Renewables). Approach with a competitive acquisition or option offer, as they are likely motivated by price and deal certainty rather than local community preservation.

citations.claim: suggests the entity is not merely a passive holder but actively rotates capital

neighbors.name: Hazen Rd Nominee LLC
neighbors.claims: Hazen Rd Nominee LLC is the deeded owner of land associated with "Hazen Rentals," a 178-unit build-to-rent (BTR) community developed by Fifth Avenue Properties ([Fifth Avenue Properties](https://fifthaveproperties.com/portfolio/hazen-road-buckeye-arizona)). The site plan for this development, located at the NWC of Miller and Hazen roads, was approved by the Buckeye Planning and Zoning Commission in February 2025 ([AZBEX](https://azbex.com/planning-development/buckeye-pz-advances-multiple-projects/)). The property was originally acquired in April 2021 for $7.05 million ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/26101-W-Hazen-Rd-Buckeye-AZ-85326/92351166_zpid/)). Fifth Avenue Properties, which maintains offices in Canada and Glendale, AZ, describes the project as featuring Spanish-inspired duplex villas and significant community amenities ([Fifth Avenue Properties](https://fifthaveproperties.com/properties/hazen-rentals)). As an active developer of high-density residential housing, this entity is firmly pro-development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Medium – Controls a substantial housing project (178 units) approved by the city. As a developer, they have a stake in local infrastructure but may view industrial/energy projects as conflicting with residential appeal.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate directly with Fifth Avenue Properties. Ensure our project does not negatively impact the visual or noise amenity of their 'Hazen Rentals' community. Framing our project as complementary (e.g., grid stability for their residents) is crucial.

citations.claim: Hazen Rentals," a 178-unit build-to-rent (BTR) community developed by Fifth Avenue Properties
citations.title: Hazen Rentals - Fifth Avenue Properties

citations.claim: approved by the Buckeye Planning and Zoning Commission in February 2025
citations.title: Buckeye P&Z Advances Multiple Projects

citations.claim: property was originally acquired in April 2021 for $7.05 million
citations.title: 26101 W Hazen Rd Price History

neighbors.name: Deancurt Buckeye LLC
neighbors.claims: Deancurt Buckeye LLC is linked to Deancurt Realty Group, an investment firm based in Agawam, Massachusetts (21 Ramah Circle) ([Manta](https://www.manta.com/c/mb4mdpf/deancurt-realty-group-inc)). The entity has engaged in active management of its Buckeye assets, including filing civil lawsuits (listed as "Deancua Buckeye LLC") for eviction and utility disputes in Maricopa County Justice Courts between 2022 and 2025 ([Maricopa County Justice Courts](https://justicecourts.maricopa.gov/app/courtrecords/CaseInfo?casenumber=CC2022219452000)). In February 2023, the LLC sold a 7.3-acre residential portion of its holdings for $750,000 ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/27239-W-Hazen-Rd-Buckeye-AZ-85326/92352103_zpid/)). This pattern of acquiring, litigating for management, and selling subdivided parcels characterizes a speculative or active landlord strategy. There is no evidence of opposition to development; rather, the entity appears focused on asset appreciation and liquidation.
neighbors.influence_justification: Low – Out-of-state speculative owner. Influence is limited to their immediate property rights and legal actions regarding tenancy.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the Massachusetts principals (Deancurt Realty Group) with a financial proposal. They are demonstrated sellers (recent 2023 sale) and appear to be managing the property as a remote investment portfolio. They are likely amenable to a buyout or easement if the price is right.

citations.claim: linked to Deancurt Realty Group, an investment firm based in Agawam, Massachusetts (21 Ramah Circle)
citations.title: Deancurt Realty Group Corporate Filing

overview_summary: Screening of 26 neighbors within a 0.5-mile radius identified 16 residents and 10 organizations, including family trusts, corporate landlords like Invitation Homes, and the Parkside at Buckeye HOA. While 21 neighbors hold low or unknown influence, the profile includes two high-influence entities—Arizona Public Service (APS) and the local HOA—and three medium-influence stakeholders. No opposition was identified, with four neighbors supporting the project and one remaining neutral, as most organizational entities are driven by financial interests and property values. The neighbor landscape is primarily composed of passive investors and residential interests, with no documented evidence of organized community resistance.
